24DEFAULT_HEMI = "left" 

25 

26VALID_VIEWS = ( 

27 "anterior", 

28 "posterior", 

29 "medial", 

30 "lateral", 

31 "dorsal", 

32 "ventral", 

33 "left", 

34 "right", 

35) 

36 

37VALID_HEMISPHERES = "left", "right", "both" 

38 

39 

40def get_surface_backend(engine=DEFAULT_ENGINE): 

41 """Instantiate and return the required backend engine. 

42 

43 Parameters 

44 ---------- 

45 engine: :obj:`str`, default='matplotlib' 

46 Name of the required backend engine. Can be ``matplotlib`` or 

47 ``plotly``. 

48 

49 Returns 

50 ------- 

51 backend : :class:`~nilearn.plotting.surface._matplotlib_backend` or 

52 :class:`~nilearn.plotting.surface._plotly_backend`. 

53 The backend module for the specified engine. 

54 """ 

55 check_parameter_in_allowed(engine, ["matplotlib", "plotly"], "engine") 

56 if engine == "matplotlib": 

57 if is_matplotlib_installed(): 

58 import nilearn.plotting.surface._matplotlib_backend as backend 

59 else: 

60 raise ImportError( 

61 "Using engine='matplotlib' requires that ``matplotlib`` is " 

62 "installed." 

63 ) 

64 elif engine == "plotly": 

65 if is_plotly_installed(): 

66 import nilearn.plotting.surface._plotly_backend as backend 

67 else: 

68 raise ImportError( 

69 "Using engine='plotly' requires that ``plotly`` is installed." 

70 ) 

71 

72 return backend 

73 

74 

75def check_engine_params(params, engine): 

76 """Check default values of the parameters that are not implemented for 

77 current engine and warn the user if the parameter has other value then 

78 None. 

79 

80 Parameters 

81 ---------- 

82 params: :obj:`dict` 

83 A dictionary where keys are the unimplemented parameter names for a 

84 specific engine and values are the assigned value for corresponding 

85 parameter. 

86 """ 

87 for parameter, value in params.items(): 

88 if value is not None: 

89 warn( 

90 f"'{parameter}' is not implemented " 

91 f"for the {engine} engine.\n" 

92 f"Got '{parameter} = {value}'.\n" 

93 f"Use '{parameter} = None' to silence this warning.", 

94 stacklevel=find_stack_level(), 

95 ) 

96

98def _check_hemisphere_is_valid(hemi): 

99 return hemi in VALID_HEMISPHERES 

100 

101 

102def check_hemispheres(hemispheres): 

103 """Check whether the hemispheres passed to in plot_img_on_surf are \ 

104 correct. 

105 

106 hemispheres : :obj:`list` 

107 Any combination of 'left' and 'right'. 

108 

109 """ 

110 invalid_hemis = [ 

111 not _check_hemisphere_is_valid(hemi) for hemi in hemispheres 

112 ] 

113 if any(invalid_hemis): 

114 raise ValueError( 

115 "Invalid hemispheres definition!\n" 

116 f"Got: {np.array(hemispheres)[invalid_hemis]!s}\n" 

117 f"Supported values are: {VALID_HEMISPHERES!s}" 

118 ) 

119 return hemispheres 

120 

121 

122def check_surf_map(surf_map, n_vertices): 

123 """Help for plot_surf. 

124 

125 This function checks the dimensions of provided surf_map. 

126 """ 

127 surf_map_data = load_surf_data(surf_map) 

128 if surf_map_data.ndim != 1: 

129 raise ValueError( 

130 "'surf_map' can only have one dimension " 

131 f"but has '{surf_map_data.ndim}' dimensions" 

132 ) 

133 if surf_map_data.shape[0] != n_vertices: 

134 raise ValueError( 

135 "The surf_map does not have the same number " 

136 "of vertices as the mesh." 

137 ) 

138 return surf_map_data 

139 

140 

141def _check_view_is_valid(view) -> bool: 

142 """Check whether a single view is one of two valid input types. 

143 

144 Parameters 

145 ---------- 

146 view : :obj:`str` in {"anterior", "posterior", "medial", "lateral", 

147 "dorsal", "ventral" or pair of floats (elev, azim). 

148 

149 Returns 

150 ------- 

151 valid : True if view is valid, False otherwise. 

152 """ 

153 if isinstance(view, str) and (view in VALID_VIEWS): 

154 return True 

155 return ( 

156 isinstance(view, Sequence) 

157 and len(view) == 2 

158 and all(isinstance(x, (int, float)) for x in view) 

159 ) 

160 

161 

162def check_views(views) -> list: 

163 """Check whether the views passed to in plot_img_on_surf are correct. 

164 

165 Parameters 

166 ---------- 

167 views : :obj:`list` 

168 Any combination of strings in {"anterior", "posterior", "medial", 

169 "lateral", "dorsal", "ventral"} and / or pair of floats (elev, azim). 

170 

171 Returns 

172 ------- 

173 views : :obj:`list` 

174 Views given as inputs. 

175 """ 

176 invalid_views = [not _check_view_is_valid(view) for view in views] 

177 

178 if any(invalid_views): 

179 raise ValueError( 

180 "Invalid view definition!\n" 

181 f"Got: {np.array(views)[invalid_views]!s}\n" 

182 f"Supported values are: {VALID_VIEWS!s}" 

183 " or a sequence of length 2" 

184 " setting the elevation and azimut of the camera." 

185 ) 

186 

187 return views 

188 

189 

190def _check_bg_map(bg_map, hemi): 

191 """Get the requested hemisphere if ``bg_map`` is a 

192 :obj:`~nilearn.surface.SurfaceImage`. If the hemisphere is not present, 

193 raise an error. If the hemisphere is `"both"`, concatenate the left and 

194 right hemispheres. 

195 

196 Parameters 

197 ---------- 

198 bg_map : Any 

199 

200 hemi : :obj:`str` 

201 

202 Returns 

203 ------- 

204 bg_map : :obj:`str` | :obj:`pathlib.Path` | :obj:`numpy.ndarray` | None 

205 """ 

206 if isinstance(bg_map, SurfaceImage): 206 ↛ 207line 206 didn't jump to line 207 because the condition on line 206 was never true

207 if len(bg_map.shape) > 1 and bg_map.shape[1] > 1: 

208 raise TypeError( 

209 "Input data has incompatible dimensionality. " 

210 f"Expected dimension is ({bg_map.shape[0]},) " 

211 f"or ({bg_map.shape[0]}, 1) " 

212 f"and you provided a {bg_map.shape} surface image." 

213 ) 

214 if hemi == "both": 

215 bg_map = get_data(bg_map) 

216 else: 

217 assert bg_map.data.parts[hemi] is not None 

218 bg_map = bg_map.data.parts[hemi] 

219 return bg_map 

220 

221 

222def _get_hemi(surf_mesh, hemi): 

223 """Check that a given hemisphere exists in a 

224 :obj:`~nilearn.surface.PolyMesh` and return the corresponding 

225 ``surf_mesh``. If "both" is requested, combine the left and right 

226 hemispheres. 

227 

228 Parameters 

229 ---------- 

230 surf_mesh: :obj:`~nilearn.surface.PolyMesh` 

231 The surface mesh object containing the left and/or right hemisphere 

232 meshes. 

233 hemi: {'left', 'right', 'both'} 

234 

235 Returns 

236 ------- 

237 surf_mesh : :obj:`numpy.ndarray`, :obj:`~nilearn.surface.InMemoryMesh` 

238 Surface mesh corresponding to the specified ``hemi``. 

239 

240 - If ``hemi='left'`` or ``hemi='right'``, returns 

241 :obj:`numpy.ndarray`. 

242 - If ``hemi='both'``, returns :obj:`~nilearn.surface.InMemoryMesh` 

243 """ 

244 check_is_of_allowed_type(surf_mesh, (PolyMesh,), "surf_mesh") 

245 check_parameter_in_allowed(hemi, ["both", "left", "right"], "hemi") 

246 

247 if hemi == "both": 

248 return combine_hemispheres_meshes(surf_mesh) 

249 elif hemi in ["left", "right"]: 

250 if hemi in surf_mesh.parts: 

251 return surf_mesh.parts[hemi] 

252 else: 

253 raise ValueError( 

254 f"{hemi=} does not exist in mesh. Available hemispheres are:" 

255 f"{surf_mesh.parts.keys()}." 

256 ) 

257 

258 

259@fill_doc 

260def check_surface_plotting_inputs( 

261 surf_map, 

262 surf_mesh, 

263 hemi=DEFAULT_HEMI, 

264 bg_map=None, 

265 map_var_name="surf_map", 

266 mesh_var_name="surf_mesh", 

267): 

268 """Check inputs for surface plotting. 

269 

270 Where possible this will 'convert' the inputs if 

271 :obj:`~nilearn.surface.SurfaceImage` or :obj:`~nilearn.surface.PolyMesh` 

272 objects are passed to be able to give them to the surface plotting 

273 functions. 

274 

275 - ``surf_mesh`` and ``surf_map`` cannot be `None` at the same time. 

276 - If ``surf_mesh=None``, then ``surf_map`` should be of type 

277 :obj:`~nilearn.surface.SurfaceImage`. 

278 - ``surf_mesh`` cannot be of type :obj:`~nilearn.surface.SurfaceImage`. 

279 - If ``surf_map`` and ``bg_map`` are of type 

280 :obj:`~nilearn.surface.SurfaceImage`, ``bg_map.mesh`` should be equal to 

281 ``surf_map.mesh``. 

282 

283 Parameters 

284 ---------- 

285 surf_map: :obj:`~nilearn.surface.SurfaceImage` | :obj:`numpy.ndarray` 

286 | None 

287 

288 %(surf_mesh)s 

289 If `None` is passed, then ``surf_map`` must be a 

290 :obj:`~nilearn.surface.SurfaceImage` instance and the mesh from that 

291 :obj:`~nilearn.surface.SurfaceImage` instance will be used. 

292 

293 %(hemi)s 

294 

295 %(bg_map)s 

296 

297 Returns 

298 ------- 

299 surf_map : :obj:`numpy.ndarray` 

300 

301 surf_mesh : :obj:`numpy.ndarray`, :obj:`~nilearn.surface.InMemoryMesh` 

302 Surface mesh corresponding to the specified ``hemi``. 

303 

304 - If ``hemi='left'`` or ``hemi='right'``, returns 

305 :obj:`numpy.ndarray`. 

306 - If ``hemi='both'``, returns :obj:`~nilearn.surface.InMemoryMesh` 

307 bg_map : :obj:`str` | :obj:`pathlib.Path` | :obj:`numpy.ndarray` | None 

308 

309 """ 

310 if surf_mesh is None and surf_map is None: 310 ↛ 311line 310 didn't jump to line 311 because the condition on line 310 was never true

311 raise TypeError( 

312 f"{mesh_var_name} and {map_var_name} cannot both be None." 

313 f"If you want to pass {mesh_var_name}=None, " 

314 f"then {mesh_var_name} must be a SurfaceImage instance." 

315 ) 

316 

317 if surf_mesh is None and not isinstance(surf_map, SurfaceImage): 317 ↛ 318line 317 didn't jump to line 318 because the condition on line 317 was never true

318 raise TypeError( 

319 f"If you want to pass {mesh_var_name}=None, " 

320 f"then {map_var_name} must be a SurfaceImage instance. " 

321 f"Got surf_map={surf_map.__class__.__name__}" 

322 ) 

323 

324 if isinstance(surf_mesh, SurfaceImage): 324 ↛ 325line 324 didn't jump to line 325 because the condition on line 324 was never true

325 raise TypeError( 

326 "'surf_mesh' cannot be a SurfaceImage instance. ", 

327 "Accepted types are: str, list of two numpy.ndarray, " 

328 "InMemoryMesh, PolyMesh, or None.", 

329 ) 

330 

331 if isinstance(surf_mesh, PolyMesh): 331 ↛ 332line 331 didn't jump to line 332 because the condition on line 331 was never true

332 surf_mesh = _get_hemi(surf_mesh, hemi) 

333 

334 if isinstance(surf_map, SurfaceImage): 334 ↛ 335line 334 didn't jump to line 335 because the condition on line 334 was never true

335 if len(surf_map.shape) > 1 and surf_map.shape[1] > 1: 

336 raise TypeError( 

337 "Input data has incompatible dimensionality. " 

338 f"Expected dimension is ({surf_map.shape[0]},) " 

339 f"or ({surf_map.shape[0]}, 1) " 

340 f"and you provided a {surf_map.shape} surface image." 

341 ) 

342 

343 if isinstance(bg_map, SurfaceImage): 

344 check_polymesh_equal(bg_map.mesh, surf_map.mesh) 

345 

346 if surf_mesh is None: 

347 surf_mesh = _get_hemi(surf_map.mesh, hemi) 

348 

349 # concatenate the left and right data if hemi is "both" 

350 if hemi == "both": 

351 surf_map = get_data(surf_map).T 

352 else: 

353 surf_map = surf_map.data.parts[hemi].T 

354 

355 bg_map = _check_bg_map(bg_map, hemi) 

356 

357 return surf_map, surf_mesh, bg_map 

358 

359 

360def get_bg_data(bg_map, n_vertices): 

361 """Get bg_data for bg_map and check if its number of vertices comply with 

362 n_vertices. 

363 If bg_map is None, return an array of n_vertices elements with value 

364 0.5. 

365 If bg_map is not None, but number of vertices is not equal to 

366 n_vertices, raise ValueError. 

367 """ 

368 if bg_map is None: 

369 bg_data = np.ones(n_vertices) * 0.5 

370 else: 

371 bg_data = np.copy(load_surf_data(bg_map)) 

372 if bg_data.shape[0] != n_vertices: 

373 raise ValueError( 

374 "The bg_map does not have the same number " 

375 "of vertices as the mesh." 

376 ) 

377 return bg_data 

378 

379 

380def get_faces_on_edge(faces, parc_idx): 

381 """Identify which faces lie on the outeredge of the parcellation defined by 

382 the indices in parc_idx. 

383 

384 Parameters 

385 ---------- 

386 faces : :obj:`numpy.ndarray` of shape (n, 3), indices of the mesh faces 

387 

388 parc_idx : :obj:`numpy.ndarray`, indices of the vertices of the region to 

389 be plotted 

390 

391 """ 

392 # count how many vertices belong to the given parcellation in each face 

393 verts_per_face = np.isin(faces, parc_idx).sum(axis=1) 

394 

395 # test if parcellation forms regions 

396 if np.all(verts_per_face < 2): 

397 raise ValueError("Vertices in parcellation do not form region.") 

398 

399 vertices_on_edge = np.intersect1d( 

400 np.unique(faces[verts_per_face == 2]), parc_idx 

401 ) 

402 faces_outside_edge = np.isin(faces, vertices_on_edge).sum(axis=1) 

403 

404 return np.logical_and(faces_outside_edge > 0, verts_per_face < 3) 

405 

406 

407def sanitize_hemi_view(hemi, view): 

408 """Check ``hemi`` and ``view``, if ``view`` is `None`, set value for 

409 ``view`` depending on the ``hemi`` value and return ``view``. 

410 """ 

411 check_hemispheres([hemi]) 

412 if view is None: 

413 view = "dorsal" if hemi == "both" else "lateral" 

414 check_views([view]) 

415 return view
